question: Which Bank has been authorized to issue Electoral Bonds in India?
explanation:
The Ministry of Finance has authorised State Bank of India (SBI) to issue and encash Electoral Bonds. These bonds would be made available through SBIâ€™s 29 Authorized Branches from 19th October to 28th of October this year. The is the 14th phase of sale.
Electoral Bonds will be valid for fifteen calendar days from the date of issue and no payment will be made to any payee Political Party if the Electoral Bond is deposited after expiry of the validity period.
